column6: The Science of Pets and How to Care for Them
column7: An introduction to companion animal biology through consideration of the physical structure, nutrition, behavior, and reproduction of animal species most commonly kept as companions. The basic information is applied to discussion of basic preventive health care. Course content is largely focused on cats and dogs, although other mammals, birds and reptiles will be briefly considered. Legal and economic issues, and ethical considerations associated with companion animals are also incorporated into the course discussion. Credit is not given for both ANSC 207 and ANSC 307.
column9: Credit is not given for both ANSC 207 and ANSC 307.
column10: Nat Sci & Tech - Life Sciences course.
